text: Hi. Does anyone know if there is some kind of secure signature on query results? How can a client validate that the results of a REST call has indeed gone through the consensus?
<@U0ZJZBJLF>: currently query is only to the peer to which it is addressed.
<@U0ULK2JPP>:  yeah I know, but what I'm asking is- does the answering peer has any "proof" that the query went through consensus? I don't see such a thing in the REST doc on github
there is only a secureContext which doesn't prove that
<@U0ZJZBJLF>: the query - currently - does not go through consensus at all. It is directly responded to by the peer to which it is addressed.
yeah, you're right. I was under the impression that it behaves like doChainTransaction in helper/handler.go
